author: souuuf
body:
# Support Question
Hello, 

I want to generate a json file from a result of Get-AzureADUser Query.

My output is this:
[
    {
        "DisplayName":  "xxxx",
        "UserPrincipalName":  "yyyy",
        "Country":  null,
        "City":  null
    },
    {
        "DisplayName":  "uuu",
        "UserPrincipalName":  "ooo",
        "Country":  null,
        "City":  null
    }
]
-----
and I want to generate this : (adding the key Values to this result)
{
"Values":[
    {
        "DisplayName":  "xxxx",
        "UserPrincipalName":  "yyyy",
        "Country":  null,
        "City":  null
    },
    {
        "DisplayName":  "uuu",
        "UserPrincipalName":  "ooo",
        "Country":  null,
        "City":  null
    }
]
}
-------
How I can modify my code to get this format please ?
below my code:

$Users = Get-AzureADUser -Filter "startswith(displayName,'soufiane')"
 
$Users | where {$_.userprincipalname -like "*web*"} | Select DisplayName, UserPrincipalName, Country, City  | ConvertTo-Json -depth 100 | Out-File "C:\Users.txt"

[PowerShell Support Lifecycle](https://aka.ms/pslifecycle)

comments.body: @souuuf The repo is for PowerShell development. For getting help please use community resources like forums and chats.

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as external and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been be closed for housekeeping purposes.

title: Add key to result JSON
